Country Name: Data from database: Global Financial Development

Series Name: Short definition

Country Code: Bank regulatory capital to risk-weighted assets (%)
Series Name: The capital adequacy of deposit takers. It is a ratio of total regulatory capital to its assets held, weighted according to risk of those assets.
Series Code: Reported by IMF staff. Note that due to differences in national accounting, taxation, and supervisory regimes, these data are not strictly comparable across countries.
2001 [YR2001]: Financial Soundness Indicators Database (fsi.imf.org), International Monetary Fund (IMF)

Country Code: Bank nonperforming loans to gross loans (%)
Series Name: Ratio of defaulting loans (payments of interest and principal past due by 90 days or more) to total gross loans (total value of loan portfolio). The loan amount recorded as nonperforming includes the gross value of the loan as recorded on the balance sheet, not just the amount that is overdue.
Series Code: Reported by IMF staff. Note that due to differences in national accounting, taxation, and supervisory regimes, these data are not strictly comparable across countries.
2001 [YR2001]: Financial Soundness Indicators Database (fsi.imf.org), International Monetary Fund (IMF)

Series Name: Accounting value of bank's net interest revenue as a share of its average interest-bearing (total earning) assets.
Series Code: Accounting value of bank's net interest revenue as a share of its average interest-bearing (total earning) assets. Raw data are from Bankscope and Orbis. The formula applied to Bankscope is data2080[t] / ((data2010[t] + data2010[t-1])/2) and a comparable approach is applied to Orbis. Numerator and denominator are aggregated on the country level before division. Note that banks used in the calculation might differ between indicators. Calculated from underlying bank-by-bank unconsolidated data from Bankscope and Orbis. The result is not reported if a country-year has less than 3 bank-level observations.
2001 [YR2001]: Bankscope (2000-14) and Orbis (2015-21), Bureau van Dijk (BvD)

Country Code: Bank return on assets (%, after tax)
Series Name: Commercial banks’ after-tax net income to yearly averaged total assets.
Series Code: Commercial banks’ after-tax net income to yearly averaged total assets. Raw data are from Bankscope and Orbis. The formula applied to Bankscope is data2115[t] / ((data2025[t] + data2025[t-1])/2) and a comparable approach is applied to Orbis. Numerator and denominator are first aggregated on the country level before division. Note that banks used in the calculation might differ between indicators. Calculated from underlying bank-by-bank unconsolidated data from Bankscope and Orbis. The result is not reported if a country-year has less than 3 bank-level observations.
2001 [YR2001]: Bankscope (2000-14) and Orbis (2015-21), Bureau van Dijk (BvD)

Country Code: Bank return on equity (%, after tax)
Series Name: Commercial banks’ after-tax net income to yearly averaged equity.
Series Code: Commercial banks’ after-tax net income to yearly averaged equity. Raw data are from Bankscope and Orbis. The formula applied to Bankscope is data2115[t] / ((data2055[t] + data2055[t-1])/2) and a comparable approach is applied to Orbis. Numerator and denominator are first aggregated on the country level before division. Note that banks used in the calculation might differ between indicators. Calculated from underlying bank-by-bank unconsolidated data from Bankscope and Orbis. The result is not reported if a country-year has less than 3 bank-level observations.
2001 [YR2001]: Bankscope (2000-14) and Orbis (2015-21), Bureau van Dijk (BvD)

Series Name: The total value of demand, time and saving deposits at domestic deposit money banks as a share of GDP. Deposit money banks comprise commercial banks and other financial institutions that accept transferable deposits, such as demand deposits.
Series Code: Demand, time and saving deposits in deposit money banks as a share of GDP. Raw data are from the electronic version of the IMF’s International Financial Statistics. Bank deposits (IFS lines 24, 25, FOST and FOSD); GDP in local currency (IFS line NGDP); end-of period CPI (IFS line PCPI); and average annual CPI is calculated using the monthly CPI values (IFS line PCPI).
2001 [YR2001]: International Financial Statistics (IFS), International Monetary Fund (IMF)

Country Code: Bank noninterest income to total income (%)
Series Name: Bank’s income that has been generated by noninterest related activities as a percentage of total income (net-interest income plus noninterest income). Noninterest related income includes net gains on trading and derivatives, net gains on other securities, net fees and commissions and other operating income.
Series Code: Bank’s income that has been generated by noninterest related activities as a percentage of total income (net-interest income plus noninterest income). Noninterest related income includes net gains on trading and derivatives, net gains on other securities, net fees and commissions and other operating income. Raw data are from Bankscope and Orbis. The formula applied to Bankscope is data2085 / (data2080 + data2085) and a comparable approach is applied to Orbis. Number is only calculated when net-interest income is not negative. Note that banks used in the calculation might differ between indicators. Calculated from underlying bank-by-bank unconsolidated data from Bankscope and Orbis. The result is not reported if a country-year has less than 3 bank-level observations.
2001 [YR2001]: Bankscope (2000-14) and Orbis (2015-21), Bureau van Dijk (BvD)

Series Name: Stock price volatility is the average of the 360-day volatility of the national stock market index.
Series Code: Stock price volatility is the average of the 360-day volatility of the national stock market index.

Country Code: Bank return on assets (%, before tax)
Series Name: Commercial banks’ pre-tax income to yearly averaged total assets.
Series Code: Commercial banks’ pre-tax income to yearly averaged total assets. Raw data are from Bankscope and Orbis. The formula applied to Bankscope is data10270[t] / ((data2025[t] + data2025[t-1])/2) and a comparable approach is applied to Orbis. Numerator and denominator are first aggregated on the country level before division. Note that banks used in the calculation might differ between indicators. Calculated from underlying bank-by-bank unconsolidated data from Bankscope and Orbis. The result is not reported if a country-year has less than 3 bank-level observations.
2001 [YR2001]: Bankscope (2000-14) and Orbis (2015-21), Bureau van Dijk (BvD)

Country Code: Bank return on equity (%, before tax)
Series Name: Commercial banks’ pre-tax income to yearly averaged equity.
Series Code: Commercial banks’ pre-tax income to yearly averaged equity. Raw data are from Bankscope and Orbis. The formula applied to Bankscope is data10270[t] / ((data2055[t] + data2055[t-1])/2) and a comparable approach is applied to Orbis. Numerator and denominator are first aggregated on the country level before division. Note that banks used in the calculation might differ between indicators. Calculated from underlying bank-by-bank unconsolidated data from Bankscope and Orbis. The result is not reported if a country-year has less than 3 bank-level observations.
2001 [YR2001]: Bankscope (2000-14) and Orbis (2015-21), Bureau van Dijk (BvD)
